intro: Anerincleistus setulosus var. floccosus, commonly known as the woolly spiny vine, is a tropical plant characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and thorny stems. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often found in dense undergrowth of rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and growth habits, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
